remarks: The union of two simple graphs with loops (with the same vertex set): If ` <. V , E >. ` and ` <. V , F >. ` are (simple) graphs (with loops), then ` <. V , E u. F >. ` is a multigraph (the vertex set stays the same, but the edges from both graphs are kept, maybe resulting incident two edges between two vertices), analogous to ~ umgraun .  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 10-Aug-2017.)
statement:
uslgraun.e $e |- ( ph -> E Fn A ) $.
uslgraun.f $e |- ( ph -> F Fn B ) $.
uslgraun.i $e |- ( ph -> ( A i^i B ) = (/) ) $.
uslgraun.ge $e |- ( ph -> V USLGrph E ) $.
uslgraun.gf $e |- ( ph -> V USLGrph F ) $.
uslgraun $p |- ( ph -> V UMGrph ( E u. F ) ) $.
